Event.name: Commerce_collect
Event.definition:
<def-root>Subframe of Commerce_money-transfer in which the <fen>Seller</fen> comes to have the <fen>Money</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Seller">The man at the counter</fex> <t>collected</t> <fex name="Money">payment</fex> <fex name="Buyer">from Lee</fex> <fex name="Goods">for his dry-cleaning</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Buyer
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Buyer</fen> wants the <fen>Goods</fen> and offers <fen>Money</fen> to a <fen>Seller</fen> in exchange for them. <ex>The pizza man <t>collected</t> $35 <fex name="Buyer">from Lee</fex> for his order.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Goods
Arg.definition: <def-root>The FE <fen>Goods</fen> is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for <fen>Money</fen> in a transaction. <ex>The man at the counter <t>collected</t> payment from Lee <fex name="Goods">for his dry-cleaning</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>The means by which a commercial transaction occurs. <ex>The money was <t>collected</t> <fex name="Means">through a credit card transaction</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Money
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Money</fen> is the thing given in exchange for <fen>Goods</fen> in a transaction. <ex>The clerk <t>collected</t> <fex name="Money">$49.95</fex> from the customer for the merchandise.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Rate
Arg.definition: <def-root>In some cases, price or payment is described per unit of <fen>Goods</fen>. <ex>The cleaner <t>collects</t> <fex name="Rate">forty dollers per hour</fex> for his services.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Seller
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Seller</fen> has possession of the <fen>Goods</fen> and exchanges them for <fen>Money</fen> from a <fen>Buyer</fen>. <ex><fex name="Seller">The salesman</fex> <t>collected</t> the money from the customer.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Unit
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE is any unit in which goods or services can be measured. Generally, it occurs in a <ment>by</ment>-PP.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>The purpose for which an intentional act is performed.</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fex name="Explanation">Explanation</fex> for which an event occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the collection event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the <fen>Seller</fen> that affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>). <ex>He <fex name="Manner">carefully</fex> <t>collected</t> all his debts.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: collect.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: call for and receive (something) as a right or due.

lexUnit.name: charge.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: demand (an amount) as a price for a service rendered or goods supplied.

lexUnit.name: collection.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: receive money in return for goods or services promised or delivered.
